title: Romelu Lukaku sends Matthijs de Ligt back to Ajax's academy with nutmeg for Inter Milan
text:
Matthijs de Ligt struggled with Romelu Lukaku’s pace and power in the first half (Picture: Getty)

Romelu Lukaku failed to find the net on his return from injury as Juventus beat Inter Milan 2-1 on Sunday, but the striker showed his class in a thrilling top-of-the-table clash at the San Siro.

A thigh problem meant Lukaku missed Inter’s Champions League defeat to Barcelona last Wednesday and Antonio Conte had no hesitation putting the 26-year-old straight back into his starting XI this weekend.

The Belgian has scored three goals since his £74million move from Manchester United and will have been desperate to add to his tally against Juve, but Gonzalo Higuain stole the headlines with a late winner for the Serie A champions.

Lautaro Martinez cancelled out Paulo Dybala’s opener with a penalty in the 18th minute and the match looked to be heading for a draw. Second-half substitute Higuain had other ideas, though.

Lukaku’s display pleased Inter manager Conte (Picture: Getty)

The ex-Chelsea forward slotted past Samir Handanovic with ten minutes remaining and Maurizio Sarri’s men held on for three points to leapfrog Inter at the top of the table.

Advertisement

Advertisement

While it was not the result he would have hoped for, Lukaku may be able to take some comfort from the fact he made Matthijs de Ligt look rather silly in the first half.

With the scoreline at 1-1, Lukaku picked up the ball deep inside Inter’s half and shrugged off Miralem Pjanic before putting the ball through De Ligt’s legs to set up a counter-attack.

Dybala’s shot was comfortably saved by Wojciech Szczesny as De Ligt scrambled back to try and atone for his error.

Lukaku destroying De Ligt 😍 pic.twitter.com/X4qIjMJ8zU — InterYaSoul (@InterYaSoul) October 6, 2019

De Ligt won’t want to see this again…

Lukaku out there ruining De Ligt 👀 pic.twitter.com/N1DvbUjb4R — J. Velazquez (@JuanDirection58) October 6, 2019

Inter boss Conte is hopeful Lukaku can put his recent injury troubles behind him after a promising performance against Juve.

‘Romelu is definitely a player that must train more, because being a player with a massive body he needs to train, to play, to be in great shape,’ Conte said following Inter’s defeat.

‘At the start of the season he had this back issue, now he’s been dealing with this other quadricep issue since the game against Lazio.

‘But I think he gave everything, it’s inevitable that against Barcelona we didn’t have Lukaku and it was important to have him. And we didn’t have him.

‘However, Romelu was very committed today and he tried to do his best.

‘Now let’s hope he can leave these little issues behind him and be at his 100 per cent.’
